src: tɕendɤre nɯnɯ kɤ-ɣɯt-a tɕe tɕe nɯ-nɯ-sɯɣ-ʁaʁ-a
trs: I brought (the eggs) and made them hatch by myself (without a hen).' (150819 kumpGa, 47)

src: nɯnɯ ɯ-pʰe ``wortɕʰi" tɤ-ti-nɯ tɕe nɯnɯ kɯ a-jɤ-tɯ́-wɣ-ɕ-pʰɣo-nɯ ma,
trs: Say `please' to him, and he will help you flee (from here).' (Norbzang 2012, 74-75)

src: ɯ-xɕɤt tɯ\redp{}tu ʑo to-ɣɤɕqali ri tɕe ɯ-kɯr ɯ-ŋgɯ qandʐe nɯ pjɤ-nɯ-ɕ-lɯɣ tɕe ɯ-zda ra kɯ jo-nɯ-tsɯm-nɯ
trs: (The crow) shouted with all his strength, dropped the earthworm that was in its mouth, and its companion took it.' (2011-10-qajdo, 98-100)

src: kupa-skɤt to-ɕ-lɯɣ-a
trs: I spoke Chinese by mistake.' (`I should have spoken Japhug') (heard in context)

src: tɤrʁaʁkɕi nɯ kɯ nɯra ɯ-ɕombri ra ɲɤ-sɯɣ-lɯɣ
trs: The hunting dog took off its chains.' (140426 liegou he zhonggo-zh, 10)

src: [tɯ-ŋga nɯra ɯ-mbe tʰɯ-kɯ-ɴɢraʁ nɯra] tú-wɣ-ʑ-ŋga-ndʑi,
trs: (Their$_i$ stepmother was evil), and made the two of them$_i$ wear old and torn clothes.' (140429 jiedi-zh, 12)

src: a-tɤ-ri kɤ-ʑɴɢoʁ
trs: Pull the threads for me.' (elicited)

src: tɤjŋoʁ kɯ tɯ-ŋga ko-sɯ-ʑɴɢoʁ
trs: He hung the clothes on the hook.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-pʰoŋbu cʰonɤ si, tɤjtsi nɯnɯra tɯ-tɯ-xtɕɤr ku-kɤ-βzu nɯnɯ tɕe, kɤ-zbraʁ tu-kɯ-ti ŋu.
trs: (Whether a person or whatever), attaching his body together with a tree or a pillar is called \forme{zbraʁ}.' (150902 kAxtCAr, 14)

src: nɤ-pi ni kɯ ``nɯna-j nɤ nɯna-j" ʑo kɤtɯpa-ndʑi ri, maka ʑo kɤ-z-nɯna a-mɤ-tɤ-tɯ-kʰɯ ma,
trs: Your two brothers will repeatedly say `let us rest', but you should never agree to let them rest.' (2003 qachga, 131-1322)

src: ɯ-pi kɯ jo-ɣi tɕe, tɯ-ci kɤ-ɕar to-z-nɯna tɕe
trs: His brother came and stopped looking for water.' (2002 nyimawodzer, 66)

src: kʰa ɯ-sta tɤ-nɯ-sɯqaʁ-a
trs: I delimited the site (to build) the house.' (elicited)

src: nɯ mɤkɯftsʰi ɲɯ-kɯ-nɯsɯkʰo-a pɯ\redp{}pɯ-ɕti qʰe, kɯki aʑo sɤlaŋphɤn ki pjɯ-qri-a ŋu
trs: If you (try) to take it from me forcibly, I will break this basin.' (150831 jubaopen-zh, 105-106)

src: tɕeri tɤɕime nɯ kɯ, tɕe ɯ-wa nɯ kɯ mɯ-tó-wɣ-sɯftsʰi qʰe, nɯnɯ ɕɯŋgɯ ɯ-sŋi tʰɯtʰɤci pɯ-kɯ-fse nɯnɯra ɯ-wa ɯ-tɯ-fɕɤt pjɤ-βzu
trs: The girl, pressed by her father, told her father everything that had happened in the day before that.' (140429 qingwa wangzi-zh, 110)

src: wuma ʑo ɲɯ-mŋɤm tɕendɤre mɯ-cʰɤ-ftsʰi tɕe pjɤ-ɣi tɕe
trs: It hurt a lot, she could not stand it and came (down to Mbarkham for treatment).' (12-BzaNsa, 102-103)

src: kɤ-anbaʁ-a
trs: I hid.' (elicited)

src: a-rɟit ra nɯ-ɣi-nɯ ɕti tɕetʰa, kɤ-ndza kowa tɯ́-wɣ-βzu ɕti tɕe ku-ta-sɯ-ɤnbaʁ ŋu
trs: My children are about to come back and will try to eat you, I have to hide you (help you hide).' (Norbzang 2012, 300-301)

src: tɤ-mu nɯ kɯ  tɤ-pɤtso ra kʰri ɯ-pa zɯ ko-sɯ-ɤnbaʁ
trs: The old woman hid the children under the bed.' (elicited)

src: χpi pjɯ-fɕat-a, pjɯ-kɯ-sɯ-fɕat-a-ndʑi nɯ ʁo jɤɣ
trs: I can tell a story$_i$, the two of you can have me tell it$_i$, but ...' (140511 1001 yinzi-zh, 49)

src: taʁndo mɯ́j-tɯ-tso tɕe, tɕe li tɤ-kɯ-sɯ-ʁndɯ-a
trs: You are not listening (to what I say), you caused me to be beaten again.' (2003-kWBRa, 109)

imt: bird.sp. \textsc{dem} medicine buddha \textsc{pl} \textsc{erg} once \textsc{ifr}:\textsc{down}-\textsc{caus}-bring-\textsc{pl} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} juniper \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-head \textsc{lnk} \textsc{ifr}:\textsc{down}-\textsc{auto}-\textsc{caus}-get.loose \textsc{lnk} crow \textsc{erg} once \textsc{ifr}:\textsc{down}-\textsc{caus}-bring-\textsc{pl} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} oak \textsc{3sg}.\textsc{poss}-head  \textsc{ifr}:\textsc{down}-\textsc{auto}-\textsc{caus}-get.loose
src: ɕɤɣpɣa nɯnɯ, smɤn saŋrɟɤz ra kɯ ci pjɤ-sɯ-ɣɯt-nɯ tɕe, nɯ ɕɤɣ ɯ-ku qʰe pjɤ-nɯ-ɕ-lɯɣ, tɕe qajdo kɯ ci pjɤ-sɯ-ɣɯt-nɯ ri, nɯnɯ ɕkrɤz ɯ-ku pjɤ-nɯ-ɕlɯɣ,
trs: The buddhas$_i$ sent the juniper bird$_j$ to bring the medicine$_k$ (to Gesar), but it$_j$  dropped it$_k$ on a juniper tree, they$_i$ sent a crow$_l$, but it$_l$ dropped it$_k$ on an oak.' (2003 gesar, 260)

src: tɤ-rʑaβ nɯ kɯ iɕqʰa, tsʰaŋ ɯ-ŋgɯ la-nɯ-rku kɯ-mɯm nɯra cʰɤ-tɕɤt tɕe tó-wɣ-sɯ-ndza-ndʑi pjɤ-ra.
trs: The wife had no choice but to take out the nice (food) that she had put in the cupboard and give it to (her husband and herself).' (150824 kelaosi-zh, 76)

src: nɯ ɕɤmɯɣdɯɣ kɤ-lɤt kɯ-mkʰɤz nɯra ra ma mɤ-kɯ-spa nɯra mɤ-sɯx-ɕe-nɯ.
trs: They need people who are good at shooting with guns, they don't let those who are not able (to shoot) go (to do the shooting).' (150829 KAGWcAno, 14)

src: ɣʑo ɯ-kʰo ta-fsraŋ nɯnɯ, [ɯ-pi ni mɯ-pa-sɯ-pʰɯt] ra ɣɯ, ɣʑo ra ɣɯ nɯ-rɟɤlpu nɯ jo-ɣi.
trs: The king of the bees whose hive he had protected and had prevented his brothers from destroying came.' (140510 fengwang-zh, 137)

src: rɟɤlpu kɯ ɯ-tɕɯ stu kɯ-xtɕi nɯ ɕ-ko-z-rɯru.
trs: The king sent his youngest son to guard (the apple trees).' (140507 jinniao-zh, 39)

src: tɕe ɯ-jaʁ nɯ kɯ tʰɤlwa ki cʰɯ-sɯ-ste nɯ ɯ-tʰɤcu cʰɯ-sɯ-βde
trs: (The mole) does like this with its forepaws, and throws the earth below.' (28-qapar, 155-156)

src: a-tʂʰa ci pɯ-z-mɤke pɯ-rke
trs: Serve me some tea first.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-mŋu nɯra koŋla ʑo ko-xtɕɤr ko-sɯ-ɤsɯɣ ʑo.
trs: He tied the opening (of the bag) very tightly.' (150824 kelaosi,-zh 297)

src: <luban> kɯ rcanɯ kɯ-pɯ-pe ʑo, maka mɤ-kɯ-ɤntɕʰoʁjɤr ʑo to-ti to-sɤ-pe.
trs: Luban said (the answers) very well, without missing anything.' (150902 luban-zh, 63)

src: [a-lɤn kɤ-kʰo] ɯ-tɤ-tɯ-sɤ-pe-t nɤ tɕe ku-ta-wum ŋu
trs: If you give a good answer (to all my questions), I will take you (as my disciple).' (150902 luban-zh, 48)

src: kɤ-ɣndʑɯr cʰɤ-sɯ-ɤmɲɤm
trs: He ground (the flour) very homogeneously.' (elicited)

src: paχɕi nɯ ɯ-jwaʁ kɤ-lɤt ɲɯ-z-mɤke, nɯ ɯ-qʰu tɕe ɲɯ-rɯmɯntoʁ,
trs: The apple (tree) first grows leaves, and after that blooms.' (07-paXCi, 14)

src: ɲɯ-rʑi tɕe [kɤ-fkur] mɯ́j-tɯ-wɣ-sɯx-cʰa.
trs: It is heavy, you won't be able to carry it on your back.' (elicitation)

src: kumpɣa pʰu nɯ ɲɯ-βʁa tɕe, mu nɯra mɯ-ɲɯ-sɯx-cʰe
trs: (Otherwise) the roosters are too strong, and and the hens cannot bear it.' (150819 kumpGa, 9)

src: ɯ-χpɯm pjɤ-tsʰoʁ,
trs: He knelt down.

src: tɕʰeme nɯ kɯjŋu kɯ-wxtɯ\redp{}wxti ʑo na-sɯ-ta-ndʑi ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: They$_{DU}$ forced the girl to swear a big oath.' (2003 qachga, 139)

src: tɤ-pɤtso smɤn mɤkɯftsʰi tɤ-sɯ-ndza-t-a
trs: I forced the child to eat the medicine.' (elicited)

src: aʑɯɣ kɯnɤ tɤ-z-nɯsman-a qʰe tɤ-mna ɕti
trs: I had my own (bellyache) treated (by someone) and it got better.' (2011-13-qala, 29)

src: ku-kɯ-z-rɤʑi-a-nɯ ɲɯ-ntsʰi
trs: Please let me stay (here).' (qajdoskAt 2002, 67)

src: a-mu nɤ-ndzɣi ɯ-rcʰɤβ tu-kɯ-sɯ-rtoʁ-i ra
trs: Mother, let us look at (show us the thing) that is in the interstice between your fangs?' (Norbzang 2012, 308)

src: nɤʑo tɤ-ndze ma alo ma-lɤ-tɯ-tsɯm ma tʰa li kɯ-sɯ-ʁndɯ-a
trs: Eat it, don't take it up there, you would cause me to be beaten again.' (2003-kWBRa, 71-72)

src: pjɤ-kɯ-nɯβlu-a tɕe mɤ-jɤɣ ma tɕe a-xtu kɯ-mna sɤznɤ a-mpʰɯz ɯ-ntɕʰɯr nɯ-tɯ-sɯ-pʰɯt tɕe
trs: You cheated me, it is outrageous, not only did my belly not get better, but (by misleading me) you caused a piece of my buttocks to be ripped off.' (2011-13-qala, 15)

src: nɯ maʁ nɤ, mɯ́j-tɯ-ɣi tɕe kɯ-sɯ-sat-a ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: Otherwise, by not coming, you are about to get me killed.' (2005 Kunbzang, 315)

src: <shangdian> ɯ-ŋgɯ kɤ-χtɯ ɣɤʑu
trs: It (can) be bought in a shop.' (28-CAmWGdW, 107)

src: <wugui> ɯ-kɯ-ntsɣe ɣɤʑu tɕe, nɯnɯra nɯ-ɕki li ɯ-ndza ra kɤ-χtɯ ɣɤʑu.
trs: There are people$_i$ who sell turtles$_j$, and one (can) buy their$_j$ food from them$_i$.' (140510 wugui, 33)

src: tɤ-mtʰɯm ɯ-kɯ-ntsɣe ɯ-ɕki tɕe tɤ-mtʰɯm ɕ-to-sɯ-χtɯ qʰe,
trs: She send him to buy meat at the butcher's.' (160701 poucet2, 15)

src: tɕaχpa ʁnɯz nɯ kɯ, nɤki, <alibaba> ɣɯ ɯ-kɯm nɯtɕu <fenbi> kɯ, nɤkinɯ, kɯ-ɤrtɯm ci to-sɯ-rɤt-ndʑi
trs: The two thieves drew a circle on Alibaba's door.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 181)

src: ɯ-jaʁ kɯ ju-mɯrʁɯz ɲɯ-cʰa,
trs: (The mole) can scratch it with its claws.' (28-qapar, 159)

src: ??ɯʑo kɯ sɲɯɣjɯ kɯ tɤscoz pa-sɯ-rɤt
trs: (intended meaning:) `S/he wrote the letter with the pen.' (elicited)

src: ɯʑo kɯ sɲɯɣjɯ ta-ndo tɕe tɤscoz pa-sɯ-rɤt
trs: S/he took the pen and wrote the letter with it.' (elicited)

src: kʰɤlɤβ kɯ tɯtʰɯ pɯ-ɕɯ-fkaβ-a
trs: I covered the pan with a cover.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-mu ɯ-wa ni kɯ ɲɯ-z-nɤja-ndʑi qʰe mɯ-ta-sɯ-ɣe-ndʑi,
trs: Her parents could not stand to part with her, and did not let her come.' (14-siblings, 304)

src: tɕe tɯ-ji ɲɯ-nɤja.
trs: These fields, what a shame (nobody is taking care of them).

src: mbro ɯ-jme cho nɤ-kɤrme tú-wɣ-sɯ-ɤfsuja ra
trs: Let us compare the (length) of the horse's tail and that of your hair.' (`Let us see which is longest.') (2014-kWlAG, 675)

src: mbro nɯnɯ ɯ-ku pjɤ-sɯ-pʰɯt tɕe, ɯ-ku nɯnɯ ʑara ɣɯ nɯ-kɤntɕʰaʁ ɣɯ ɯ-kɯm nɯtɕu to-sɯ-ɕɯ-ɴqoʁ.
trs: She had (people) behead the horse, and hang its head on the city gate.' (140428 mu e guniang-zh, 107-108)

src: nɯnɯ kɯ pjɯ́-wɣ-sɯ-sɯ-spoʁ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: One makes a hole (into it) with this.' (24-mbGo, 8)

src: ci nɯ tɕe tɕe smi pjɯ́-wɣ-βlɯ tɕe nɯ smɯmba nɯ kɯ ɯ-rme nɯ kú-wɣ-sɯ-sɯ-βɣɯt ɲɯ-ra.
trs: The other (method to take out chicken feathers) is to make a fire and burn off the feathers with the flames.' (150907 kAnWtChWwWt, 21)

src: pɯ-ta-sɯ-sɯ-rɤt
trs: I made you write it$_i$ with it$_j$ .

src: nɤ-pi ni tɤ-tɯ-βri-t ŋu
trs: You saved your two elder brothers.' (qachGa 2003, 130)

src: ki a-tɤ-tɯ-ndze qʰe qʰe ɯ-qa nɯtɕu tɯ-ndzrɯ jamar ci ʑo a-nɯ-tɯ-sɯɣ-ri ma
trs: When you eat this, leave a (quantity of) about a nail (from it in the bowl).' (2003kandZislama, 80)

src: tɯ-ŋga nɯ-χtɕi-t-a tɕe a-pɯ-ndzar tɕe cʰɯ́-wɣ-ɕkʰo jɤɣ
trs: I have washed the clothes, let them first drip dry before putting them to the sun to dry.' (elicited)

src: mbrɤz kɯ-fse lo, <cai> kɯ-fse nɯnɯra tɕe, ɯ-ŋgɯ tɯ-ci kɯ-tu nɯra pjɯ́-wɣ-sɯ-ɤrɕo tɕe, nɯnɯ ``pɯ-mdzar-a" tu-kɯ-ti ŋu.
trs: When one has completely removed the water in the rice or in a dish, one says \forme{pɯ-mdzar-a}.' (definition)

src: ɯ-pʰɯ ɲɯ-wxti tɕe, nɯra tʰamtɕɤt ma-tɤ-tɯ-ɣɤ-wxti
trs: It is expensive, make it less expensive.' (2010-12, 13)

src: [cʰa ɯ-tsʰi] lo-ɣɤ-tɕʰom
trs: He drank too much alcohol.' (elicited)

src: cʰɤtsʰi ko-ɣɤ-tɕʰom
trs: He had drunk too much alcohol.' (150829 jidian-zh, 16)

src: rgɤtpu nɯ kɯ ɯ-tɕɯ ja-stʰoʁ tɕe, ɯ-xɕɤt ɯ-lɤt to-ɣɤ-tɕʰom tɕe
trs: The old man pushed his son, but exerted too much strength and...'   (150831 jubaopen-zh, 161-162)

src: kʰa ɯ-ʁɤri nɯtɕu ɯ-fkrɤm a-kɤ-tɯ-ɣɤ-βdi
trs: Place these nicely (in order) in front of the house.' (smanmi 2003.1, 253)

imtwordshtml: neg-aor-caus-be.possible-pst:tr-1sg
src: [kɤ-nɯ-ɬoʁ] mɯ-tɤ-ɣɤ-kʰɯ-t-a.
trs: I preventing it/him from coming out.' (elicited)

src: [ɯ-rŋɯl kɤ-tu] tɤ-ɣɤ-kʰɯ-t-a.
trs: I made it possible for him.her to have money.'  (elicited)

src: a-xɕɤt ʑo tu-ɣɤte tɕe
trs: (The rain, flowing on my body), gives me (makes me have) strength.' (150819 woniu-zh, 55)

src: rɟɤlpu nɯ ɯ-kɤ-ti na-ɣɤ-me
trs: He made the king unable to say anything.' (2005 tAwakWcqraR, 110)

src: kɯmaʁ ɯ-ɣi nɯra nɯ-rtsawa mɯ-pjɤ-nɯ-ɣɤ-wxti
trs: He did not consider his other relatives to be as important (as his wife).' (kWjujmAlu 2003, 64)

src: ɯ-kɯ-n-nɤmqe, ɯ-kɯ-nɤre, ɯ-kɯ-ɣɤ-kʰe nɯra ɲɯ-xcat ʑo.
trs: There were many people scolding him, making fun of him, calling him stupid.' (150829 phaRrgot, 13)

src: cʰɐ́ɟi ne-kɐ-səɣ-cʰiʔ=nəʔ mimʔ=cə
trs: Beer is tasty when one allows it to sweeten (naturally and gradually).

src: cʰɐ́ɟi ne-kɐ-wɐ-cʰiʔ=nəʔ mimʔ=cə
trs: Beer is tasty when one sweetens it (e.g. by adding sugar).

src: tɕe tɤjko mɯ-tɤ-tɕur tɕe, ɴɢolo ɯ-mat nɯ ɲɯ́-wɣ-pʰɯt tɕe, tɕe tɤrca pjɯ́-wɣ-ɣɤ-la tɕe, tɕe tɤjko pjɯ-sɯx-tɕur cʰa.
trs: When the pickle$_i$ is not sour, one picks fruits from the \textit{Ribes stenocarpum}$_j$, soaks it together (with it$_i$), and it$_j$ can make the pickle sour.' (18-NGolo, 27)

src: ɯ-tɯ-tɕur kɯ tɯ-kɯr ɯ-ŋgɯ lú-wɣ-rku qʰe maka ɲɯ-sɯ-ɤmɯ-zɣɯt qʰe, tɯ-pʰoŋbu ra kɯnɤ ɲɯ-sɯx-tɕur kɯ-fse ɕti
trs: It is so sour that when one puts it into one's mouth, it makes everything (sour in an even way), as if one's whole body becomes sour.' (09-mi, 68)

src: <cai> ɯ-tɯ-tɕur mɯ́j-rtaʁ tɕe, <cu> pɯ-lat-a tɕe pɯ-ɣɤ-tɕur-a
trs: As the dish was not sour enough, I added vinegar to make it sourer.' (elicited)

src: nɯnɯ kɯ maka nɯ-mɲaʁ tu-ɣɤ-mtɤm cʰa ri,
trs: That (plant) can cure their blindness (cause their eyes to recover eyesight).' (140517 mogui de jing-zh, 85)

src: iɕqʰa tɯ-xtsa nɯni tɤ-kɤ-sŋaʁ pjɤ-ɕti tɕe tɕendɤre, ɲɤ-ʑɣɤ-ɣɤ-xtɕi-ndʑi
trs: The shoes had been enchanted, and became small by themselves.' (160706 poucet6, 98)

src: tɕe tʂu ri ɲɤ-tɯ-z-ɣɤ-βdi-t ɕti tɕe, tɕe nɯtɕu a-kɤ-tɯ-ɕe
trs: (Since) you have already had the road repaired (by someone else), (take that road) to go (east).' (2011-04-smanmi, 149)

src: ɯ-zda cʰo ɲɯ-ɤʑɯʑu-ndʑi
trs: He is wrestling with his friend.' (elicited)

src: ɯ-zda ɲɯ-ɤz-nɯ-ɤʑɯʑu
trs: He is wrestling his friend.' (elicited)

src: tɕe iʑo kɯrɯ ra tɕe tʂʰɤlu nɯ stu ji-kɤ-rga ɕti
trs: Milk tea is the one (the type of tea) that we Tibetans like most.' (05-qaZo, 169)

imt: coloured.belt \textsc{dem} \textsc{1pl} Tibetan woman \textsc{pl} \textsc{gen} \textsc{dem} absolutely \textsc{emph} \textsc{ipfv}-exist \textsc{sbj}:\textsc{pcp}-be.needed \textsc{lnk} most \textsc{1pl}.\textsc{poss}-\textsc{obj}:\textsc{pcp}-\textsc{appl}-like be.\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact}
src: tʰaχtsa nɯ iʑo kɯrɯ tɕʰeme ra ɣɯ, nɯnɯ mɤlɤn ʑo pjɯ-tu kɯ-ra tɕe, stu ji-kɤ-nɯ-rga ɕti,
trs: Coloured belts are something that we Tibetan woman must absolutely have, and it is what we like most.' (thaXtsa 2002, 92)

src: ma aʑo [qajɯ nɯra kɤ-nɤrtoχpjɤt] pɯ-rga-a tɕe
trs: I used to like to observe bugs.' (26-quspunmbro, 15)

src: ɲɯ-ta-nɤ-pe ɕti qʰe, aʑo ɲɯ-ta-nɯ-rga
trs: I like you, I love you.' (160630 abao-zh, 113)

src: nɯnɯ rɟɤlpu ɯ-tɕɯ nɯ kɯ a-pɯ́-wɣ-nɯ-rga-a ra
trs: May the prince love me!' (150819 haidenver-zh, 531)

src: tɯrme mɤ-kɤ-nɯfse nɯ ɯ-ɕki ɲɯ-ɤndzɯt
trs: (The dog) is barking at the unknown person.' (elicited)

src: tɯrme mɤ-kɤ-nɯfse nɯ ɲɯ-ɤz-nɯ-ɤndzɯt
trs: (The dog) is barking at the unknown person.' (elicited)

src: nɯnɯ aʑo ɯ-ɲɯ-kɯ-nɤ-stu-a nɤ, tɕendɤre, nɯɕimɯma ʑo ɕe-tɕi tɕe,
trs: If you believe me, let us go (there) immediately.' (140425 shizi huli he lu-zh, 23)

src: [ɯʑo kɯ ta-tɯt] nɯ ma-nɯ-tɯ-nɤ-ste
trs: Don't believe what he said.' (elicited)

src: [nɤʑo tɤ-tɯ-tɯt] nɯ mɤ-stu-a
trs: I don't believe what you said.' (elicited)

src: tɤ-tɕɯ tʰamtɕɤt kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn nɯ ɣɯrnɤɣɯr ʑo tu-ɣɤɕqali-nɯ tɕe, tɕendɤre rɯdaʁ nɯra ɲɯ-mu-nɯ tɕe cʰɯ-pʰɣo-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: The men (hunters) all shout together in great number, and the wild animals being afraid flee downstream.' (150829 KAGWcAno, 10-11)

src: nɯnɯ kɯ tɯrme wuma ʑo ɲɯ-kɯ-nɯɣ-mu.
trs: It is very afraid of people.' (24-ZmbrWpGa, 26)

src: <xiaocui> nɯ tɤ-rɯstɯnmɯ ɯ-qʰu qʰe tɕe iɕqʰa [<yuanfeng> nɯ, taʁndo mɤ-kɯ-tso nɯ cʰo] sɲikuku ʑo tɯtɯrca ɲɯ-ɤ<nɯ>ɣro-ndʑi qʰe
trs: After she married, Xiaocui played every day with Yuanfeng, who did not understand speech.' (150909 xiaocui-zh, 66)

src: mɤʑɯ kɯmtɕʰɯ kɯ-fse tɤ-tu nɤ, tɯɣrɤz ɲɯ-nɯ-ɤɣro-ndʑi nɯra pjɤ-ŋgrɤl,
trs: Whenever there was a toy$_i$, they(\textsc{du}) played with it$_i$ together.' (lWlu, 17)

src: tɕhemɤpɯ nɯ ɯ-sni ɲɤ-zdɯɣ
trs: The little girl was very sad.' (140504 huiguniang-zh, 101)

src: laʁnɯ-sŋi pjɤ-zdɯɣ-ndʑi tɕe,
trs: They had (worked) hard for several days.' (qajdoskAt 2002, 35)

src: kʰa nɯtɕu ɕ-to-k-ɤkʰu-ci
trs: He went and called towards the house.' (2011-05-nyima, 78)

src: tɕʰeme ɯ-skɤt kɯ-snɯ\redp{}sna ci kɯ ʑo tú-wɣ-nɯ-ɤkʰɤzŋga-nɯ ntsɯ.
trs: A girl who had a beautiful voice was calling them.' (2003kandZislama, 9)

src: ji-<baogao> tɤ-lɤt, <piaozi> ɕ-tɤ-nɯŋke, <dianzhan> βzu-j ŋu
trs: Make a report for us, go and look for money, and we will build an electric station.' (2010-09, 169)

src: tɯ-ji ɯ-ŋgɯ aʁɤndɯndɤt tu-kɯ-nɯ-ŋke kʰɯ tɕe
trs: One can walk (on this path) everywhere in the fields (as one wishes).' (15-06-05)

src: tɤ-lu koŋla ʑo kú-wɣ-nɤmdzɯ ɲɯ-ra ma ʁlɤwur ʑo tu-mbuz ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: One has to look after the milk (in the pan), otherwise it will spill out as soon as (it boils).' (elicited)

src: tɯrme ra, ʑimkʰɤm ʑo, ɲɯ-z-nɯ-sŋom-a-nɯ cʰa-a
trs: I will be able to make a lot of people envy (me for my dress).' (jinai de guniang-zh, 22)

src: nɤ-sɤtɕʰa ɯ-ɲɯ-tɯ-nɤ-xtɕi nɤ, aʑo a-βlu ci tu tɕe,
trs: If you find your place too small for you, I have an idea.' (150829 taishan zhi zhu-zh,203)

src: aʑo a-nɯ́-wɣ-nɤntsʰi-a ra
trs: (Aladin thought) `May the princess love me.'' (140511 alading-zh, 196)

src: nɯnɯ ɕɤɣ nɯ wuma ʑo pe, tɕe pjɯ́-wɣ-βlɯ tɕe ɯ-di wuma mnɤm
trs: The juniper is very nice, when one burns it it has a strong smell.' (08-CAG, 24-25)

src: srɯtpʰu nɯ kɯ, ŋotɕu rɤʑi-nɯ pjɤ-sɯχsɤl matɕi, nɯ-di tu-nɤ-mnɤm pjɤ-ɕti tɕe pjɤ-mtsʰɤm.
trs: The ogre realized where they where, as it was sniffing them out and perceived (their smell).' (160706 poucet6, 53-54)

src: jɤ-ɣi tɕe, pɤjkʰu tu-ta-nɤ-mnɤm
trs: Come (here), I will smell you (to see if you have had alcohol).' (140506 loBzi, 11)

src: (T) atu tɤʁaʁ ɯ-pɯ́-sɤ-scit? [...]
trs: Was the party up there nice?

src: nɯnɯ ɯ-rme ɯ-ŋgɯ ri ku-ɕe tɕe tɕendɤre ku-ɕe nɤ ku-ɕe tɕe tɕe ɯ-ndʐi ɯ-ŋgɯ ri ku-otsa ɲɯ-ŋu. tɕe fsapaʁ ra kɯ nɯ nɤ-sɤɣ-dɯɣ-nɯ ŋgrɤl ma
trs: (Its seeds) go into the hair (of the sheep), deeper and deeper and stick into their skin, and the animals find this unpleasant.' (19-khWlu, 107-109)

src: nɤʑo ndɤre ɲɯ-ta-nɤ-ɣɤ-βzi
trs: You, I think that you are easily drunk.' (elicited)
